With much tremendous effort, and much added weight on his back, Tucson make=
s a dash through the portal, on swift front and hind legs.=C2=A0 His tail s=
traight out in back of him like a rudder, he sounds another roar, to be sur=
e someone on the other end hears him.=C2=A0 It rumbles like thunder clappin=
g the land at a very close proximity.=C2=A0 The dragon was on his way home,=
 and back to the land he had vowed to protect.=C2=A0 
=C2=A0
The soul of th=
e old dragon kindles brightly within him, and it appeared that he was unbot=
hered by obsticles however difficult they may prove.=C2=A0 A burst of bravo=
ry with a bit of tenacity and determination, urges him forward on his journ=
ey to set things right once again.


________________________________
From:=
 Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...>
To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
Sent:=
 Wednesday, December 7, 2011 12:05 PM
Subject: Re: Into the Teeth! (Tuscon)=



=C2=A0 
> <OLD>
>
> Tucson looks back to Big Convoy. He was bent on goin=
g through.
>
> "We continue on, we take our chances through the portal. Som=
ething tells me
> it's the way to go. All right, this is it, all or nothing=
."
>
> With another powerful roar, he charges onward, this time, slowly ext=
ending
> his wings, feeling that the need for flight would come soon enough=
. He
> could feel his limbs comming off the ground, as he extends his talon=
s to Big
> Convoy and the others.
>
> "Those of you who can get on my back,=
 do so now, Big Convoy, grab onto my
> talons, and hold on as tight as you =
can. I sense I may need to take
> flight.. Something is driving me to fly."=


<NEW>

As BIG CONVOY was nearly the same size as TUSCON, only a few inche=
s of
hieght and a few pounds of weight seperated the two, there was no way
=
for TUSCON to carry him. However BREAK and MACH KICK climb on TUSCON's
back=
, thier combined wieght nearly half of his if not more. Even with
those two=
 it could make for a rough flight of he had to fly.

CONVOY nodded, "Go thr=
ough now! I will do what I have to do once I get
on the other side."

Keyin=
g his radio spoke into it. "We're going through the portal." He
said to LON=
G RACK. "I don't know how much communication we will have
on the other side=
." He paused meaningfully, "Get everyone home."

"But sir . . " LONG RACK r=
esponded.

"That is an order!" BIG CONVOY responded evenly.

"Yes sir." LON=
G RACK came back. "I read you loud and clear."

Turning back to TUSCON if h=
e was still in the room he made shooing
motions as all around them the soun=
ds of many booted feet could be
heard running down the halls. It would only=
 be a matter of moments
before they were over run.

Pulling out several gre=
nades BIG CONOY looked around the room, "Before
we go we're going to leave =
them a little gift!"

Letting the safety clips detatch he smiled as he saw =
the pins hit the
floor. He tossed them near the door, watched them bounce a=
nd then dove
through the portal!

(TAG)

- Preston

nces through the portal. Something tells me<BR>> it's the way to go. All=
 right, this is it, all or nothing."<BR>><BR>> With another powerful =
roar, he charges onward, this time, slowly extending<BR>> his wings, fee=
ling that the need for flight would come soon enough. He<BR>> could feel=

Convoy and the others.<BR>><BR>> "Those of you who can get on my back=
, do so now, Big Convoy, grab onto my<BR>> talons, and hold on as tight =
as you can. I sense I may need to take<BR>> flight.. Something is drivin=

ize as TUSCON, only a few inches of<BR>hieght and a few pounds of weight se=

f of his if not more. Even with<BR>those two it could make for a rough flig=
ht of he had to fly.<BR><BR>CONVOY nodded, "Go through now! I will do what =
I have to do once I get<BR>on the other side."<BR><BR>Keying his radio spok=
e into it. "We're going through the portal." He<BR>said to LONG RACK. "I do=
n't know how much communication we will have<BR>on the other side." He paus=
ed meaningfully, "Get everyone home."<BR><BR>"But sir . . " LONG RACK respo=
nded.<BR><BR>"That is an order!" BIG CONVOY responded evenly.<BR><BR>"Yes s=
ir." LONG RACK came back. "I read you loud and clear."<BR><BR>Turning back =
to TUSCON if he was still in the room he made shooing<BR>motions as all aro=
und them the sounds of many booted feet could be<BR>heard running down the =
halls. It would only be a matter of moments<BR>before they were over run.<B=

fety clips detatch he smiled as he saw the pins hit the<BR>floor. He tossed=
